ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Professor Gillingham is an excellent and logical teacher with a great command of all different econometric techniques that we discussed in our discussionsof the empirical material.

The course was well-structured, and really well-taught. Ken is a really good and engaged instructor. I would highly recommend the course both as a methods class (to learn econometric and other economic methodologies) and to learn more about energy and environmental economics.
The course is for Phd, so master students should really consider the difficulty of the class before taking it.
The accessibility of the readings was very different, some readings being interesting and helpful, others not clear at all. The first more general lectures and readings were particularly helpful.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Initial lectures on empirical methods in environmental economics and also lectures on dynamic optimization.
Professor Gillingham is always willing to work with you and he knows about the field really well. I really enjoyed his passion and dynamic on the class
Advanced econometric techniques discussed in the context of applied research.
The readings and discussions. Very student discussion focused course.
presentations
The focus on recent research and breadth of topics.

Good coverage of current topics in environmental and energy economics. Professor described his expectations very clearly and consistently. Seminar format was engaging and professor created an atmosphere very conducive to learning. I never felt "stupid" asking a question.
The presentation of classic papers gave me a good training on how the paper is organised and developed.
Spending extended time with the papers. It could be beneficial to read less papers but spend more time on them.

The readings were good, except for the behavioral part. That was too little too fast and seemed somewhat out of place.I like the student presentations and the instructor participation in the presentations.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Some of the student presentations could have been improved.
paper summary

Reading were long and complex and thus took a lot of time to complete each week. Not doing all the readings limited discussion. Fewer readings that could be done in more depth with more discussion would be better.
I enjoyed some topics more than others, but that is inevitable in a course like this one. Also, enjoyment of a topic does not necessarily correlate with usefulness, or value to the target audience.
More explanation on the concepts and foundation...
The pace of the course was at times too fast (for myself) to get much out of the discussions.
I would suggest weekly write ups of the papers. Even just a paragraph to make sure students at least browse the papers.Maybe don't let so many masters students take the course.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Yes. Ken was very good to leading and directing discussion such that it was helpful and effective for everyone in the class.
Yes the discussion was very interactive, but I feel I cannot say anything when I didn't have enough time to finish the readings...
The presentations and discussions were generally helpful, sometimes they ended up being not very accessible.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: The course is pretty self selective, thus it fits my interest fairly well, also Prof. Gillingham is incredibly knowledgeable about what he is talking about, he knows the material covered very very well and is responsive to any specific question I had.
Fits very well into the rest of the program. Applies theoretical econometric techniques and economics concepts to interesting and leading papers in the field that I am interested in.
very helpful
An academic approach to my broad research area was helpful to learn new methodologies, data sets, and research topics.
This course is a good one to push my schedule of final master's project.
It was useful to be exposed to a range of research topics and methods in environmental economics. It was maybe not the perfectly suitable for master students at times.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I want to learn cutting edge economic research in energy field and I am also tired of fluffy environment strategy classes offered, I also want to work with a professor who is passionate about student and what he does, I was not disappointed.
To gain exposure to challenging and advanced academic papers in env econ.
Wanted to learn more about energy economics.
learn energy economics
To get an overview of recent research in enviro econ.
Required field course for PhD students in environmental economics.
Because it's the most advanced class for focusing of environment economics.
Interesting topics and to gain exposure to methods used in research in environmental and energy economics.
It is the field I am interested in.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yep
Yes.
It met and surpassed my expectations. I probably needed more time to take it all in.
yes

FES 904 was an excellent course that addressed a very important need in the environmental economics program. The course was very helpful for understanding the latest empirical techniques in the field.
Absolutely, I learned a lot!
Yes.
Yes, but I feel I need more training in Econometrics and the theories.
I expected more focus on methods (like the first lectures and readings). Some of the time spent on readings (and in class) was not beneficial at all.

Yes, although I would like maybe more applied problem sets. I think having the students presents is really good, especially with the instructor helping out so much. But more applied econometrics would be useful.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: We organized our own work groups, it is very helpful to have a discussion group on the material before class

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Very interesting course, but be sure you have taken the prerequisites, as discussions are often technical.
Well, work hard to make most of it, if you are used to sitting on a FES class and doing nothing, this class is not for you.
Take your time to do all the readings and learn their techniques! It really helps your overall development as an academic researcher.
Start your paper early and go in to office hours.
Only take this course if you have a deep interest in enviro econ topics, but if you do this course is a must.
Take it!
Start reading the materials early, but don't necessarily go too detail.
Make sure to know the reasons for taking the class. It is geared for PhD students and thus not a 100 % suitable for students possibly not pursuing an academic career.
Don't take this if you are a masters student.
